Reviews.Title: “Nicely located downtown - HUGE concierge lounge”
Reviews.Author: remerton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night last week. It was a nice surprise to find a Marriott in downtown Dallas. Formerly a Westin (I believe), it is adjacent to an urban mall / office building with an indoor ice rink in the center. Self-service parking is available; however, this is not affiliated with the hotel and is fairly pricey. I left the ramp twice - $18 after a few hours and $11 overnight. By contrast, I parked in valet at The Fairmont a couple blocks away and it was $18 for the entire day. The bar / restaurant in the lobby is nice and the service is great. No Guiness on draft, but they did have it in bottles. The concierge lounge on the top (16th) floor is reportedly the largest in North America and offers a view of downtown. The food offered there is superior to most Marriott locations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room - Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: penrenpo
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Dallas at the last minute for a family member's surgery at Baylor Medical, while my sister already had a reservation for an event she was coming for in Dallas. They offered me the same rate as her online booking, and our room was great! Clean, comfy beds, etc. We had a college party across the hall that we had to complain about constantly, and our other "neighbors" were doing the same. Finally, at 3pm, the party was ended by the hotel manager and they evicted the group. When I went to speak with the manager about it the next morning, they comped us another night's stay. This worked out great for us because we had family members camping out in the ICU waiting room otherwise. Ralph (I think that was the manager on duty that morning), was awesome and very apologetic. It was nice to know that my family would have a place to sleep that night without having to spend money they couldn't afford. I will definitely be back! Hopefully, without the college kids this time, but I know the staff will take care of it if that happens again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: brad120
Reviews.Content: What a great place! It is clean, close to Downtown, and has fabulous service. The executive lounge is really wonderful. The only reservation I have is that you might want to ask to be placed on the side of the hotel that is opposite the ice skating rink and shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Business-Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravlinMan_10
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently when in Dallas and am always satisfied. The brand new concierge lounge is very nice and the breakfast served is great. I even stayed here during the construction phase as they were updating and upgrading and service was still very good. Close enough to Uptown and downtown to enjoy without being so close that you are in the midst of the mobs. My only complaint is that the exhaust in the bathrooms is not adequate and so shower steam lingers. This is true of all of the rooms I stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room/bed”
Reviews.Author: angelaac
Reviews.Content: The worst ever. Upon entering I noticed a strange odor so my instinct and past experience of checking hotels kicked in. I went straight to the bedspread and noticed it had dried white stains and I freaked. I called in and asked housekeeping to bring me fresh pillowcases, be sheets and extra blankets all in a plastic bag. Trust me, its worth it. The last thing you want are bed bugs or sleeping in dried up urine and other bodily fluids. I then checked the bathroom and noticed urine stains all over the toilet seat!! Seriously? Housekeeping came in short after and had requested if she could clean it. I felt pretty embarrassed. The only thing that's kept me from giving this an absolute poor rating is that housekeeping was prompt when I requested sheets in a bag. Other than that, its really disgusting here and management really needs to up the game by cleaning things.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location in downtown Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: evenpargolf
Reviews.Content: From the time you arrive you are greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The valet parking attendants were cheerful and quickly unloaded our and luggage and helped us get to the check-in area, where we were greeted by a friendly staff that had us quickly checked in and helped to our room. The room was large, modern and clean. The AC and the TV both worked properly as they should. The TV is a very modern flat screen 42" model that has numerous channels. The beds were firm but comfortable. The bathroom is large with a big shower area. The vanitly was large with plenty of room for both of us the lay out our vanity items. The marble floors were very nice. Outside the bath is a large closet and bar area. The hotel is next to the DART for those desiring to travel to other locations around Dallas. The next time we are in downtown Dallas we will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Libguppy
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference at another hotel and needed to stay the night after a late banquet. Got a great offer via email including free parking, internet and breakfast the next morning so cancelled the conference hotel reservation and went with the Marriott. Glad I did! It doesn't look the best on the outside, not bad, but nothing awe-inspiring. But inside, it's tasteful, smells acceptable and the staff are fabulous from the second you walk in the door. Jason scooped us right up to the desk, we were checked in within 2 minutes and told to catch the elevator and the bags would be up shortly. And they were. He showed us how the room operated and filled the ice bucket. The room was a nice size with comfortable air and good TV choices. Mini-fridge would have been nice. Bed was firm for my taste, but comfortable enough. Room was tastefully renovated without garish colors or weird fixtures. Bed has reading lamps on the headboards. I was very happy with the bathroom. Big enough to move around in, for once the vanity had space to hold a woman's beautification tools, the tub worked easily with no nonsense fixtures that you don't need a degree in rocket science to figure out and the water was the correct temperature. This hotel is very convenient to DART and back with Pearl St. station right there. It was drizzly rain and we were fine with coat and umbrella in hand. We didn't get down to the mall, but it looked fun. It was a little noisy with the skating rink open... next time I will ask for a city view room. Breakfast was a buffet, but good. The carbs were fresh, the eggs weren't watery and the staff were very helpful and nice. We had a nice sit down before leaving back to the real world. With the package deal, we saved at least $60 from the conference hotel with only a short train ride and hoof for our evening event. Would definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBH23
Reviews.Content: Convenient location with DART light rail station at the corner. The hotel faces a large atrium with shops and an ice skating rink at the bottom. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. The room was a good size, clean and modern, with free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “A great, but pricey business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyLordHeuksa
Reviews.Content: I had not been to this hotel in several years. It was previously a Westin and something else before that. Back then it was a serviceable business hotel. I chose it because of the proximity to my meeting location. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised to discover how much care has gone into updating this hotel. The room was of a basic layout, but the beds, dressers, mirrors, lamps, etc., all felt new. The room was immaculate. It was one of the cleanest hotel rooms I've come across. It included a good-sized flat screen TV, which was a nice touch. The service I received at check-in, and in responding to various questions I had about the area was excellent. I didn't have an opportunity to dine in their restaurant. This is a very good business hotel. Be warned that it's not very close to the Dallas nightlife, but that's just a short cab ride away. Given the time of year (late January) and the location, I thought the price was high. All in all, though, it was a good experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel Ruined By Noisy Guests”
Reviews.Author: moviechic8
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has just been renovated, so the spacious new rooms were a nice treat during my stay for business in Dallas. The hotel is clean, modern and very nice and I am giving all of that 4 stars. HOWEVER, my stay here was absolutely horrible. I happened to be staying here the night of a college prom-like event and the hotel (every floor) was occupied by noisy, drunken college kids. The hotel tried to control them, but there were so many that they could not be controlled and, to be honest, they were paying for so many rooms and suites, I don't think they wanted to loose money and kick them all out of the hotel. I called the front desk 4-5 times and had to move rooms 3 times, to 3 different floors - these kids were SO loud and running down the hallways with garbage cans filled to the brim with beer bottles. I think if I had stayed here any other weekend, things would have been fine (I loved the hotel). Pros: -Clean rooms that are modern and very spacious -Comfortable, clean bed Cons: -Noise (but I think it was just a problem on this particular weekend) -Location as there are not too many restaurants within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Expected better of Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 3 nights there for Dallas Market. First night we were tired so left the car with the valet (mandatory 23.00 a day) and went down to the one available restaurant. Nice lady seated us and we listened to the wind whistle thru for 30 minutes. After I got up and went back to the hostess, she at least got us some water (no ice, just water). We started visiting with the groups on either side of our table during dinner and they got the same service we did. After we were finally served, the food was great, except for the shrimp cocktail, which tasted a little strange. I thought it might be some unusual herbage in the boil, but by midnight I was ill. There was a strange repetitive noise all night in the A/C fan. After letting them know about it, it was fixed the next day, and they said they could offer us breakfast. (Did not want more food)! Shower was great! The room was pretty clean except for the dust bunnies on the bathroom floor that got all over my slacks when changing clothes. Don't think we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room with good weekend rates”
Reviews.Author: Geddes_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a weekend and were pleased with the weekend rate that included breakfast. The rooms were large and comfortable - ours overlooked the galleria and the indoor skating rink. The retail section of the galleria keeps 'office hours', so don't expect much open after 5pm. At the weekend this part of Dallas is "quiet". We chose the hotel because of its location to public transport and its proximity to the major Dallas art galleries and museums. From that perspective it worked well. The breakfast buffet was "adequate", you wouldn't describe it as anything special, but it was fine. The service was prompt and efficient. The hotel staff gave us a number of recommendations for dinner on our 3 nights - they were good recommendations and we enjoyed them all. Our one gripe, if you choose not to use the valet parking service is that the carpark in the adjacent office tower (nothing to do with Marriott) re-sets the weekend rate at midnight on Sunday. Our early hours on Monday carpark stay was in our view, excessively expensive, for what was "off peak" park. In summary, we were well please with our stay, we felt we had received very good value for money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to AT&T Performing Arts Center”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTrips
Reviews.Content: Nice size rooms and good city views. Beds comfy, but heavy comforters are cumbersome. Nice bar menu in lieu of full dinner prices; well drinks $5 @ happy hour. No pool or hot tub, but two computer terminals available at no charge in lobby. Fun to watch ice skaters in rink adjacent to lobby. Valet parking is $23, breakfast buffet $19 with spotty service --ouch! Easy 4-5 block walk to Symphony Hall, Winspear, and Performing Arts Center. West End, Deep Ellum would require short taxi ride. Just a few blocks to Dallas Farmers Market.

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge lounge. Nicely appointed rooms.”
Reviews.Author: girlcats
Reviews.Content: If you're a Marriott Platinum rewards member you'll appreciate the newly updated concierge lounge. It's beautifully appointed with comfortable seating and dining furniture, subdued evening lighting, and great views of the Dallas skyline. The lounge is huge with enough space so you can conduct a business call without being overheard by the entire lounge. Morning and evening food selection is very good - the staff does a great job of keeping fresh food available. You can request a room with a view of the City Centre ice rink or the City itself. My king size room was well appointed, a decent size, quiet and quite comfortable, but most important it was well maintained. The lobby was still ungoing renovations during my week long stay, but if the rest of the hotel is any indication it should turnout nicely. If you are valet parking a car call at least 20 minutes ahead to have it ready for you or you risk waiting at least that long while the car is being retrieved. The gym cardio and weight equipment were new and all was in working order. Marriott seems to be putting a bit more effort into this area of their hotels - finally! The hotel has a indoor lap pool (not regulation length at approximately 20m) that as a lap swimmer I was elated to see. However I decided not to use it since it was super heated - which works well for lounging around, but not lap swimming. I will definitely stay at this hotel for upcoming Dallas business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction, but had fun”
Reviews.Author: The-Master-Planner
Reviews.Content: I took the family here for the second year in a row in December. Marriott has only owned this property for just over a year and they say renovation is almost complete (to be done by end of year). The kids really enjoyed ice skating located right there at the hotel. Christmas decorations were pretty throughout the atrium. As for the hotel, the room was nice and clean. We had a city view on the 12th floor. Room service was prompt and desserts were good, but expensive (all we ordered was dessert). The lobby was quite dusty but apparently this is the final phase of construction / renovation. The location is right downtown on the east side near the DART rail station, but a fair distance from the West End. As previously mentioned, the restaurant is temporarily located across the atrium. Breakfast was OK. Somewhat limited choices, but service was outstanding (great job Edib).

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: bkegel
Reviews.Content: I'd like to give this hotel a higher review but this place is a disappointment for a downtown Marriott. First, this place is under construction so they entry is a little confusing. Second, there is no pool, this is not very common for a Marriott so be advised. The food from room service was pretty bland and the menu was very limited. The Conciser's lounge was really disappointing, I went three times and two of the times and they were out of food. I thought they were out of drinks too but they apparently only have Dr Pepper, Pepsi and water and the coffee maker was broken. On a positive note all the staff were very nice. As far as the room it is the standard Marriott room ala 2009-2010. It is strange having a room in the atrium my window had a great view of someones office. Finally, I'm not sure if the location is very good, I didn't see any restaurants close by but there might have been a Chinese restaurant across the street. The DART train is less than a block from the hotel and it tool less than 30 minutes to get from the hotel to the airport at 8:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shane560
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the Texas/Oklahoma game. The hotel and rooms were very clean. Everybody was very friendly. Had an ice skating rink, restaurants, and a few bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms, w/ a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: crusadercc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights over a weekend at this hotel. We were in Dallas for the State Fair and booked online sight-unseen (we'd never been to this part of town before). We booked the "Family Escape" package deal which included 4 sodas, popcorn, in-room move, valet parking and breakfast - all for the same price as a normal night (go figure). Hotel was easy to find and easy to get to. Valet staff was friendly and even ran back to get my sunglasses for me when I realized I'd left them in the car. Lobby was rather plain, but it's quite clear that's only because of the renovations. Speaking of renovations, we saw no dust or debris and heard no construction noise at all. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Room was superbly clean and new - it really felt like we were the first ones to use it! Bed was a little too firm for me, but linens and pillows were nice and soft. Shower had plenty of hot water and pressure, and a large head. Our room faced the street (rather than the atrium), and was relatively quiet. The only noise we heard was somebody on the street yelling in the middle of the night - and you certainly can't fault the hotel for that (plus we were 2nd floor...a higher floor room probably wouldn't have heard it). As another reviewer said, there is a funky smell in the hallways that I think is coming from the new carpet. You don't notice it after a few minutes, but I'd expect it'll go away soon anyway. Breakfast was strangely across the atrium, a 3 minute walk from the lobby (I think a temporary location due to renovations). The food was good (usual hot food, breads, and cereal), but selection was limited in my opinion. Waiter on the first morning was curt and boring, but the waiter on the second morning was very friendly and attentive. The entire building is mixed-use, with the hotel on one side, parking garage on the other, and offices on the other two sides. The enclosed atrium has the ice skating rink and retail & food shops on the bottom two floors. Nearly everything was closed during the weekend, so don't expect to do much other than walk around and look. Access to the State Fair was a breeze. There's a DART rail stop literally adjacent to the hotel, and another station at the entrance to Fair Park. Couldn't be easier. My main gripe about the hotel? I requested room service for our popcorn and drinks and after waiting for 30 minutes without anyone showing up, I called back and canceled the order (no apology either). Would I stay here again? If I needed to be downtown, absolutely. The location can't be beat, and I felt like the value was very good. I'd just have to hope that the renovations are completed on schedule (website says Dec 2011) and the room service is improved.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay here?”
Reviews.Author: semsat
Reviews.Content: I think it is in construction, so that might be part of the problem. The hotel is attached to a sub par mall so there are at least some services and shops there but most are closed on the weekend. There is no shop to even buy an aspirin or a cracker and the vending is only drinks. Like I said, maybe this will improve after construction but it is very basic and there is very little within the few blocks around it. You are stuck in no man's land. If you were comforted in the rooms, that would help. And the rooms are fine. But, there is a charge for in room wifi (a practice I find very irritating), the cable line up was poor, there were no robes, no mini fridge, not many products. Really, kind of like a mid priced motel (without the free breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Atrium Rooms”
Reviews.Author: IMaTravelinMan2011
Reviews.Content: As of this review, the hotel is under rennovation. Many of the rooms have been updated and are very nice. The hotel lobby is under reconstruction and the jackhammering noise can be heard all the way up to the 7th floor. Perhaps the worst design flaw of the hotel is that the rooms facing the atrium are very noisy. There is an ice skating rink below. The noise from the people skating on the rink reverberates and amplifies. I stayed the on the 15th floor of the hotel you can hear the the scraping of the ice skates. People talking or yelling was even more annoying. The rink closes at 10:00 p.m. so the noise subsides at that time. Now I know why all of the rooms facing the street were booked. If you stay at this facility, insist on a room with a street view.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean...Nice”
Reviews.Author: bigolepig
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet place to stay. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable. The linens were top quality and made for a great nights sleep. The view from our room was down to the ice skating rink located in the center. Staff was friendly. Parking was adequate and spaces were decent size for a parking garage. There are several restaurants in the bottom of the hotel area, but we arrived shortly before 5pm and everything was already closed, or in the process of closing. So we opted for the bar just inside the hotel. Great choice! Try the Chocolate Strawberry Margarita...heavenly. Expensive...but heavenly!!! (I had two...regardless of the sticker price!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but chemical smell throughout”
Reviews.Author: trixy007
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very attractive with some of the most beautiful and spacious rooms I've seen in a Marriott. The hotel is very well located in the heart of downtown Dallas. It's very near the museums and was convenient to a wedding at the Belo Mansion. The problems were a strong chemical smell in the hallways and rooms perhaps from new carpets or paint and some service issues. The bellman who greeted our car tried to sell us on valet parking ($25 per night) and when we asked about self park he was evasive saying it was very complicated and he didn't know how much is was. We found out that the self park was just around the corner, with clear signage and cost $5. It was very convenient to walk across the building lobby into the hotel. Also our breakfast server in the hotel restaurant was inattentive and quite abrupt. The front desk staff on the other hand could not have been nicer or more helpful. I would stay again but only for a night or two due to the chemical smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown business & arts”
Reviews.Author: rowed65
Reviews.Content: Recently acquired and made over by Marriott. Furnishings are new and clean. Service is excellent. No concierge lounge as of March 2011, but free breakfast offered in restaurant for mariott "elite" customers. Location is within walking distance of most downtown buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoyed staying here and it is updated now too!”
Reviews.Author: dfoxsk
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a Mary Kay seminar we had in Dallas and we always stayed at this hotel but it was formerly a Westin and is now Marriott City Center. Great staff, easy check in and out and they have updated many rooms and ours was just finished. This hotel has stores, food court, restaurants, and even an ice skating rink. Will stay again next year on our annual seminar visit.

Reviews.Title: “Worst possible experience”
Reviews.Author: jean33388
Reviews.Content: We reserved a significant block of rooms (over 30 rooms) for our daughter's wedding on Memorial Day weekend. I cannot begin to describe the simply outrageously poor service, construction noise and apathetic staff. Our guests were incredibly kind and are not the complaining type, but we heard from guests (both during and following the weekend) that they had to change rooms (and even hotels) because of the extremely loud drilling above their rooms, lack of cleaning, and not receiving service after expressing their concerns. When the rooms were cleaned (note "when") they would clean bathrooms but not make beds, change towels or vacuum. Simple requests such as 2 queen beds, even when requested months in advance, were not provided. One child had to sleep on 2 chairs pulled together because a cot was "against regulation". Most importantly, when we requested help (and we called the event planner frequently) support was not provided. We met with the top brass when we left and were promised a 20% refund for guests and removal of parking an internet fees. This has NOT occurred and instead a form letter was sent to guests to "apologize" for the problems with their stay. Wow. Unbelievable for a Marriott. We were determined to not allow this to ruin a beautiful weekend for our daughter and many guests but it added undue and unneeded stress. The hotel simply should have said that there was construction. We scheduled the block of rooms a year in advance (we are from out of town) and were not told of the problems. They do not deserve anyone's business.

Reviews.Title: “Run by great people!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGert
Reviews.Content: Due to a snafu on our end, we ended up with half our party in the hotel on the other end of the sky bridge and half in the Marriott during convention weekend in June. I'd like to give a great, big gold star to this Marriott Hotel's staff for how awesome they were. On the Saturday night of our stay, one of our party experienced a blood sugar emergency. As it was the middle of the night, we figured the kitchen was closed, and her tummy is a little persnickety usually at that point anyway. We pulled out one of those microwaveable dinners that don't require refrigeration we always carry for those times when she over does and popped down to the front desk. The desk clerk immediately ushered us to use a microwave in the hotel kitchens, no questions asked. I was so grateful and impressed by that kindness! Thanks to that meal, everyone was able to return to full activities the following day. I don't think I can say enough for how much we appreciate the kindness of the night staff. I really hope someone at that hotel reads this and posts a copy just to make sure the night staff know even though mostly we're asleep when they're on duty, it is in those unexpected moments of need when one really appreciates good people. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: The location is the selling point here, if you are in town for meetings on the north end of downtown. It also is reletively close to the symphony hall, and just across the expressway from the restaurants of the McKinney Ave corridor. It is connected to a small mall area with a decent food court (and ice rink). The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The room is comfortable but nothing all that different from most hotels at this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel under current conditions”
Reviews.Author: COInsuranceWiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as guest of wedding for a 3 night stay Thursday-Sunday over Memorial Day weekend. I'm a frequent business & leisure traveler so I'm reasonably particular about hotel experiences while being realistic about the hotel rating and what I'm paying. 1. Hotel is under major renovation. If you enjoy the sound of drills and sledgehammers from 9-5, go for it. For a business trip if you're not in your room all day, not a big deal. There is no mention of this on their website that we could find, nor was it verbally disclosed at check in (apparently there's a flyer sitting on the counter but we missed it). Our first room was on the 11th floor directly above where work was being done on the 10th. Noise was insane. 2. First inquiry after being wakened by demolition, guest services advised us of the renovation, told us that calls were coming in even from the 2nd floor, and comp'd us for breakfast. After hearing this for a solid hour while getting ready we asked for another room on a floor away from where work being performed. Great, no problem, they did so. (Same thing for my pregnant daughter & son-in-law). Several other guests, same. We thought hotel put oblivious guests in these rooms and just waited to see if they would complain or not, and then deal with it. 3. Next room - directly over lobby/main entry/restaurant. 3 doors down from fitness center. Across from laundry area and meeting room where construction services people met. Quieter, yes, with the fan on full power 100% of the time. 4. Speaking of fan, temps outside were 96 degrees. A/C, set on 60, did not keep room at 74. We asked front desk to check this, to our knowledge they never did as it never cooled off to our level of comfort. 5. Light bulb out on nightstand lamp. This is just annoying. 6. Tissue box had about 5 tissues left in it, no refill, see #5. 7. We were out all day from 10:00 AM to 4:30 PM. Room was not made up when we returned. Called guest services, said they'd send someone right away. Advised we had to get ready for wedding, please come after 6:30. Response - "we don't do rooms after 5:30". So, we said, okay, 5:15. 5 minutes later, knock on door, while one of us in shower...guess who? Went to front desk and said okay, please do it now. Waited for 1/2 hour in lobby. Returned to find room still unmade. Manager then came up with clean towels & box of tissues, said he would personally assure the room would be done when we returned. Okay, it was. A box of 4 truffles for our rush to get ready. Didn't need the stress. Other guests in party had same problem. 8. Staff was pleasant but apathetic. They're probably overwhelmed with complaints. Waiter in restaurant was very nice. 9. Location is good, 1/2 block from train to West End attractions. 5-10 min to Uptown & McKinney restaurants, shopping. Recommend waiting until renovation is complete. As a Marriott Rewards member, I've had way better experiences elsewhere. If you're a business traveler, gone before 9 and back after 5, with no other needs than a bed and breakfast, just hope for a quiet and clean room when you return.

Reviews.Title: “Strangest Explanation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Travel_2_Texas
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms have small refrigerators that appear to be former mini-bars. my wife, daughter and I go out to eat and my daughter brings back some leftovers, thinking she could store them in the fridge to eat later. Well, it turns out that the fridge doesn't work, so we call the front desk and they send someone up, who says that they will see if they can find a working refrigerator and replace ours. We never hear back, so my wife calls the front desk again. This time, she is told that the non-working refrigerators are actually "coolers", and that while they won't keep something cold, they will keep things 'cool, like around room temperature". This is apparently the official line, as someone we were traveling with (we were there for a volleyball tournament) was told the same thing! This is supposed to be a high quality business hotel in downtown Dallas. Having a refrigerator that doesn't work is one thing, but coming up with the ridiculous explanation that it is actually a 'cooler' is offensive, not to mention D U M B. While the hotel is clean, there are a number of other niggling issues that would prompt me to stay elsewhere. For instance, the room we were in had two double beds, when there was more than enough room for two queen beds. The walls are paper thin, and we could hear everything, and I mean everything, that went on in the room next door. And while the bathtub had one of those clothesline thingies above it, it didn't work either. We didn't call the front desk about that one either, but would have loved to hear the explanation of what it is there for. Lastly, on our first night there, my wife discovered that she had forgotten her toothbrush. She called the front desk and was told one would be sent up. Bedtime rolls around, and still no toothbrush, so she called downstairs and cancelled her request.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, but typical”
Reviews.Author: travel4workAA
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Marriott property, nothing too special. The room was roomy, however the hallway noise and outside noise were loud. Since the air/heat was so quiet, you can hear everything around you. I was also in a room that had an adjoining room and I would hear everything in the next room. The service was good, and the location was perfect for me, also close to the Art Museum. There is an ice skating rink in the adjoining building and a food court. However only one restaurant is usually open in the evening, there is also a restaurant in the hotel. Just as a side note, watch out for the Dallas taxis as twice on this trip they tried to rip me off!!

Reviews.Title: “New to Marriott so there is still updating but very good”
Reviews.Author: Travelbeat
Reviews.Content: No. 1, you cant beat the downtown location. The service was very good and the rooms were clean and comfortable. They do not yet have a concierge lounge which will be on the top floor when it is finished. That will be spectactular. (breakfast downstairs for Gold & Plat. Members) The Concierge gentleman downstairs is extremely nice and helpfull. Be sure to use him for local knowledge. The hotel sits in a mini-mall that has an ice skating rink (yes, that is correct) and a food court.. It is near the Pearl DART Station and only 4 stops to American Airlines Center.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: SanfordSlim
Reviews.Content: As an occasional business traveler I think I understand what most business people are looking for when staying in a hotel for business. And for these purposes the Mariott City Center is OK. Not great, not bad, just OK. Bed was very comfortable - I'll give them props for that. But no free WiFi? Are you kidding? Even budget hotels offer free WiFi these days. Because I was on business and my company was paying for it, it wasn't that huge of a deal to me to buy internet access. I just thought free access was the rule rather than the exception these days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, and now a Marriott--improvements on the way”
Reviews.Author: GDAYM8_LA
Reviews.Content: Effective October 1, the Westin changed over to be a Marriott property. Every member of the staff that I encountered was friendly, patient and upbeat. My room at the hotel was quite spacious (their standard king bed room). The only down side of the room was the small bathroom--which was not very different from many other hotels. The hotel is in a good location relative to the downtown business district; there are also several breakfast and sandwich shops in the adjoining building. For Marriott "status" members, you will be interested to know that they are soon to begin construction of a conceirge lounge and expanding the exercise facilities (which will also move to the concerige floor). I was told the construction would be complete mid-2011. In the mean time, free breakfast is provided to Marriott platinum members in the restaurant on the first floor.
